website_summaries.verdict: A full-featured and powerful interface that stands out for its solid construction and stability.
cons: Software is a bit minimal, with few options
Some felt that the mic preamp was too quiet

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy as of October
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do not buy this product. The most recent Windows up date completely bricked reliable usage of this. The audio switches off when switches applications. This is consistent with multiple monitor setups. You constantly have to unplug and re plug. No driver support and poor customer service. Just buy the Scarlet 2i4o. It's on sale and I immediately know the difference. I wanted to like this so bad but the lack of support drives home my decision to return. Focusrite is the way to go. I immediately could tell the quality difference.
customer_reviews.author: McNewbs

customer_reviews.title: This over the Scarlett 2i2 any day of the week
customer_reviews.text: I had ENDLESS problems with my Focusrite device. Their customer service is also ridiculously slow and wanted me to try to fix a laundry list of things to get it to work with windows 8.1 - it was overloading my OS's audio buffer and causing my audio to completely cut out, in some cases even FREEZING the entire program I was recording with. I record podcasts and that was unacceptable. Did half the list and decided the thing wasn't worth the money. The Mackie Producer was completely, beautifully, plug and play, and produces incredible sound quality. Seriously, it's also $50 cheaper and has not had an issue with my Windows OS at ALL. A superior product.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Prost

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when I ordered this, the price was really reasonable and I was not sure if it was going to work or not with my Mac. I was truly impressed on how this device works both monitoring and sending your audio to get recorded via 2.0 usb! Without fail it has not let me down yet. It doesn’t heat up it doesn’t crash and more importantly it works better than you can imagine and we would gladly put it up against some of the other pricey devices available now!
customer_reviews.author: media1video

customer_reviews.title: Impressive, very simple, it works, sounds great, its portable, i may need a travel case for it.
customer_reviews.text: It works at 44.1khz, it works at 48khz, it sounds great. I gotta purchase an upgrade to record at 192khz on Protools but it records on the free T7 DAW at 192khz with limits on plugins. Its sounds clean and Awesome. I can get somethings done on the go for sure. The latency is incredible. I havent tried it at 192khz or with midi yet on other DAW's. Twist the knobs all the way to learn the limits. Make 1 -3 test tracks to adjust audio. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great. Already showing signs of aging/wear after 8 months. (update)
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, not great, but good for the price i guess. In hindsight, I should have saved my money for something else. The mackie driver is not the best and the interface is already showing signs of wear/ageing after 8 months. The volume pot on my interface produces a terrible noise/static when turning. The noise does not affect recording, but holy cow is it loud and annoying (and probably not good for my monitors.) *update: The static/noise that results from turning the volume pot has gotten much worse. I'm now shopping for a new audio interface. The Mackie is less than a year old.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN CUNNINGHAM

customer_reviews.title: All around great interface at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Mackie equipment is very well built and the sound is great to my ear. I’m no professional to be sure as a matter of fact I’m a beginner as far as home recording goes. I am a long time guitar player and this is a very fun tool to help expand my creativity. Very easy to cone t and get started with GarageBand and I have also started to learn the DAW that come with it. I have no doubt in Mackies workmanship and quality.
customer_reviews.author: lyra

customer_reviews.title: Onyx Producer 2-2 just works right
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Onyx Producer 2-2 now to lay down multi-track vocals and to record narration overlays on videos. The Onyx Producer 2-2 does precisely what it should. No apparent glare from overloading the mic preamp once the levels are set properly. Also, noise is very low. This suggests that the mic preamps have quite good dynamic range. This product is going to be hard to beat. Its relatively low price makes this an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Mackie logo is cute.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it with Windows 10 64bit PC,. Studio One 3, Ableton Live 10. Good point: It is very stable. And has a fast round trip latency. Onyx MicPre with good sound quality. MIDI port. Direct monitoring. Mackie logo is cute. Bad point: The green LED light is too bright. (Near the main volume knob)
customer_reviews.author: JAJAJA

customer_reviews.title: worked well when it worked - amended: usb port change solved it
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I tried every USB 2 port on my PC until I found one that works ... that and the combination of systematically deleting and reinstalling every USB device in the system seems to have worked. As I said, it works really well now that it's working :-) -- Worked very well with Reaper on Windows 10 for about two months, then stopped working. Driver recognizes the interface, but I'm not getting a signal (same mics, same setup that was working two weeks ago).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Desantis

customer_reviews.title: severe latency between analog and digital conversion
customer_reviews.text: the latency makes everything you hear digitally occur after you have played it- difficult to use tracking in real time or to punch in
customer_reviews.author: NotPaidToReview

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating Driver Installation
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nothing. Cons: Can't get this to work on Windows 10 no matter what contortions I go through (groping the web, uninstall/reinstall drivers, lots of rebooting, inserting the USB before and after reboots, ...).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t power up on iPad with all proper cables
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t power up when plugged into an iPad. Hi z buttons would light up, but phantom power or usb light wouldn’t stay on, just flash once as it was plugged in. Returned same day I recieved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb.
customer_reviews.text: Superb product for the money. Sounds great and built to last. I love the midi ports on the back of the Producer model.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Easy and simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Easy to use. Other units I had did not work, this one did.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Catalano

customer_reviews.title: The Best 2x2 USB Interface I have Owned
customer_reviews.text: I have several 2x2 USB audio interfaces and this Mackie Onyx Producer 2-2 2x2 USB Audio Interface With MIDI is the latest and greatest because of its sleek size and design along with smooth buttons and knobs. The built quality is rugged and sturdy to be thrown into the backpack (which I don't usually do because I treat my gears with respect) and it's built to last a long time. The sound is clear and it travels fast to allow live monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: Mat633

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid interface
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, tough box, built to withstand the rigors of recording. Ticks all the boxes on 24-Bit/192kHz recording, no-latency monitoring, solid hardware. However, a guitarist friend who tried it remarked the signal is not quite as clean as the Audio 6 from NI. Hence, of course, the price difference. Nevertheless, this is a great box for most recording needs.
customer_reviews.author: Grimmy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. 2 inputs.
customer_reviews.text: You can use this for audio in or out. e.g. you can output to your stereo or studio monitor(s) from your PC; and you can input from XLR mics. Mac and PC. DAC to audio is similar to that from a. The mechanics feel great, with nice solid knobs.
customer_reviews.author: Mido

product_meta.title: Mackie Audio Interface, Onyx Producer 2X2 USB Audio Interface with MIDI (Onyx Producer 2-2)
product_meta.description: Combining high-resolution 24-bit/192kHz converters with premium Mackie analog circuitry and Built-Like-A-Tank hardware design, The bus-powered Onyx Series USB Audio interfaces give you the power to capture your best performance and experience media with pristine fidelity at home or on the go. Both models offer zero-latency direct monitoring plus a headphone output, L/R line-output and +48V phantom power. The Onyx producer 2x2 expands the versatility with dual Onyx mic press and MIDI I/O for controllers, synthesizers and more.
feature_bullets: Two boutique-quality onyx mic preamps with class-leading fidelity and dynamic range XLR/TRS combo inputs accept mic, line and instrument sources 48V phantom power for use with Studio condenser mics
High-resolution 2 in x 2 Out 24-bit/192kHz recording plus MIDI I/O zero-latency direct monitoring of Analog inputs dedicated outputs for connecting studio monitors powerful headphone output
Bus-powered for easy mobile recording with no power adapter needed USB 2. 0 connectivity for fast transfer speed and low latency Built-Like-A-Tank design to survive day-to-day abuse

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars83 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
